title: Request for Body-Worn Camera Footage: Zonchez Delarfette Prince-Holmes (5/19/2023)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All unedited body-worn camera / bodycam recordings related to the following law enforcement critical incident: 

Incident Date: May 19, 2023
Location: 1100 block of Park Avenue, Orange Park, FL
Victim Name: Zonchez Delarfette Prince-Holmes

I am specifically requesting the unedited body-worn camera recordings captured by all officers present for the full duration of the incident, including audio recordings associated with the footage. 

If any portion of the requested footage must be redacted, I ask that you clearly indicate the portions that have been redacted and provide an explanation of the legal basis for the redactions. If the requested footage is withheld in its entirety, please provide a detailed explanation citing relevant public records exemption(s).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Jeffrey Lamson

title: The Murders of Abby Williams and Libby German

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: The Murders of Abby Williams and Libby German
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request all reasonably segregable, non-exempt responsive documents associated with the investigation into the murders of Abigail “Abby” Williams and Liberty “Libby” German (UFCN: 7C-IP-2134732), including but not limited to the following: 

1. Electronic communications (FD-1057 forms)
2. Incident data and summaries
3. Investigation narratives and interview synopses (FD-302 forms)
4. Collected item and evidence entry logs (FD-1087 forms)
5. Tips, leads, investigative reports, and documents shared with the FBI by other law enforcement agencies and individuals (FD-1036, titled “Import Forms”)
6. Laboratory examination requests (FD-1121 forms)
7. Search warrant affidavits and applications
8. Signed search warrants
9. Search warrant execution logs
10. Property receipts (FD-597 forms)
11. Evidence collected item logs (FD-886 forms)
12. Photographic logs (FD-674 forms)
13. Presumptive test logs

Abby and Libby were found murdered near the Monon High Bridge in Delphi, Carroll County, Indiana, on February 14, 2017. On November 11, 2024, Richard Allen was convicted of these murders and sentenced to 130 years in prison. 

Relevant media releases can be found here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1_mTpaRs-0n_oNGGezgkxsY6WD5WeRSvg

Court documents regarding the State of Indiana’s case against Richard M. Allen can be found here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/111qXoXAw9YJ_8b3KV0EsEIeiYmOHeuH1

Please note that Ronald E. Logan, who was investigated as a person of interest in 2017, passed away on January 24, 2022. As such, he no longer has personal privacy interests protected under the Privacy Act of 1974. See attached document titled “20220302_Ron_Logan_Public_Notice.pdf” for proof of death.

I would also like to request expedited processing of this request. The FBI may grant expedited processing when the request concerns a matter of widespread and exceptional media interest, which may raise questions about the government's integrity and affect public confidence (see 28 C.F.R. § 16.5(d)(iii), (iv) (2014)). 

For a significant portion of the interested public, the investigation and subsequent conviction of Richard Allen did not instill confidence. The government’s integrity is at stake. To increase transparency and restore public confidence, I intend to disseminate the requested records to a large audience in their original form, without restriction. 

If previously released records are available, I request a rolling release of those records while additional records are located and processed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carl McGehee

title: Cybercheck communications and documents

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Cybercheck communications and documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) All agreements (contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents) made since Jan. 1, 2021 between Orange County District Attorney's office and Global Intelligence Inc. (also called Cybercheck or Cybercheck.AI) for the provision of the Cybercheck service.

2) All email exchanges, including attachments, between the Orange County District Attorney's office staff of Cybercheck (including all email addresses with the domain "@cybercheck.ai") between Jan. 1, 2021 and the present.

3) All emails, including attachments, exchanged between staff at the Orange County District Attorney's office that reference Cybercheck or its provider Global Intelligence, sent between Jan. 1, 2021 and the present.

I kindly request that you waive all fees as I am a journalist and the requested records will be used for journalism in the public interest.

If you choose to impose fees, I request a detailed breakdown of the fees, including the hourly wage of each employee involved and an explanation of the employee hours required to fulfil the request.

If you choose to reject this request or redact portions of responsive documents, I ask that you provide a detailed breakdown of the statutory exemptions and associated case law underlying your decision to withhold each/any portions from public review.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jessica Hatcher

title: Banpop

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Banpop
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated during the course of the "Banpop" program, described in previously released records as a "code name for identification of Soviet illegals through fund transfers performed at Swiss banks".  A summary was provided in  a 1971 Domestic Intelligence Division inspection report: “BANPOP is the code name for a program initiated in August, 1966, in an attempt to identify illegals in the U. S. who may be receiving funds through Swiss banks. The basis for the program was an analysis of four Soviet illegal cases between 1955 and 1966 in which the Banque Populaire Swisse of Switzerland was used by the Soviets to fund illegals. The transfers are screened with the following criteria: (1) the person or individual beneficiary is named; (2) the amount of the transfer is between $300 and $5000 and (3) the last name of the person ordering and receiving is the same of of the money and is directed to a specific bank account.” (https://archive.org/details/FBI-Church-Committee-File/62-116395-441-475/page/4/mode/2up, https://archive.org/details/FBI-Church-Committee-File/62-116395-586-Bulky2/page/126/mode/2up) This is to include file 65-HQ-70741 and any associated bulky files, sub-files, and enclosures behind file.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

title: Bertram Fields FBI File

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Bertram Fields FBI File
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request access to all records, documents, reports, and correspondence in the possession of the Federal Bureau of Investigation regarding Bertram “Bert” Fields (born March 31, 1929 – died August 7, 2022), particularly in relation to:
	1.	Any FBI investigations, inquiries, or reports related to Fields’ professional activities as an attorney.
	2.	Any records concerning his interactions, employment of, or connection to Anthony Pellicano, including any references to Fields in FBI investigations of Pellicano.
	3.	Any interviews, subpoenas, or questioning of Fields by the FBI in relation to Pellicano or any other criminal inquiries.
	4.	Any surveillance, electronic monitoring, or investigatory materials in which Fields is referenced.

If any of these records are exempt from disclosure, I request that all reasonably segregable portions be released and that any redactions be clearly justified. If this request is too broad, I am willing to discuss potential modifications to facilitate processing.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cassie Sipe

title: Detailing/hiring arrangements for Jeremy Lewin (United States DOGE Service)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Detailing/hiring arrangements for Jeremy Lewin (United States DOGE Service)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

In a sworn declaration in J. Doe 1-26 vs. Musk (https://storage.courtlistener.com/recap/gov.uscourts.mdd.576293/gov.uscourts.mdd.576293.77.2.pdf), Jeremy Lewin stated that he has been employed at USAID since 1/28/2025 as a Senior Advisor. He also declares he has never worked for Elon Musk or the USDS. Jeremy Lewin was also among the initial team of DOGE staffers that arrived at the CFPB on or around 2/6/2025. He was also identified as being on the staff list at the National Institute of Health along with other identified DOGE staffer in an article published in Wired on 2/24/2025. I would like to request the following information where possible:

For USAID:
1. Any confirmation that Jeremy Lewin was formally hired at USAID on or before 1/28/2025
2. If Jeremy Lewin was detailed to the USAID from another agency, any relevant details on that arrangement that you can share, including a memorandum of understanding (or similar document) outlining his duties and responsibilities of each partner, as well as emails between the USAID and the other agency about the arrangement. I would expect this to be on our around Feb 6, 2025

For the CFPB and possibly USAID:
3. If Jeremy Lewin was hired by the CFPB, any details you can share on that appointment, including if he signed the relevant onboarding paperwork as a new hire at the agency. I would expect this to be on or around February 6, 2025
4. If Jeremy Lewin was detailed to the CFPB from another agency, any relevant details that can be shared on the memorandum of understanding (or similar documents) outlining his role and the responsibilities of each partner in this arrangement, as well as emails about the detailing arrangements where available in either USAID/State or the CFPB. I would expect these communication to be on or around February 6, 2025

For NIH and possibly USAID/CFPB:
5. If Jeremy Lewin was detailed to the National Institute of Health from the USAID or CFPB, I would like to request the corresponding memorandum of understanding or other relevant documents about that arrangement, as well as any relevant email communications you can provide from any other agency to the National Institutes of Health about that arrangement. I do not have a precise date for this, but I would expect it to be in February 2025 before 2/24/2025

For US Doge Service:
1. If you have any records that show that Jeremy Lewin was hired as an employee of USDS at any time in January or February 2025, I would appreciate that.
2. Any communications between the USDS and other agencies (USAID/Department of State) coordinating the detailing of Jeremy Lewin to agencies like the CFPB alongside other staff employed by USDS

I understand that you might not be able to provide me some agency-internal personnel records under FOIA exemptions 2 and 6, but I think it is in the public interest to understand the coordination among these agencies, and I would hope you would be able to provide me whatever relevant details can help provide more insight on what was being done in these partnerships. Please reach out if you need any clarification or want to give me feedback on my requests. Thank you.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Harris

title: Expenses For Fisher Phillips Law Firm Against the Graduate Student Union at UMass Dartmouth

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Expenses For Fisher Phillips Law Firm Against the Graduate Student Union at UMass Dartmouth
communications.communication:
Hello,

In broad terms, the purpose of this Public Records Request is to obtain the total amount of money that the university is spending on legal services against the Graduate Student Union at UMass Dartmouth. This request is not for commercial purposes, nor is it a media inquiry. This request is being made through the MuckRock public platform.

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the amount of money that has been paid or will be paid from the University of Massachusetts or any of its agents (including UMass Dartmouth) to the Fisher Phillips law firm or any of its agents (including Joseph Ambash) for services and products in any connection with the Graduate Student Union at the University of Massachusetts Dartmouth. Please also include any money obligated, encumbered, requisitioned, invoiced, contracted, retained, or agreed to be paid, as well as the retainer amount agreed upon.

Please list each expense as a separate line item with sufficient details to describe what the expense was for, the organization and account that requested it, the relevant date, the description, the amount, etc.

By the lawful deadline of Monday April 7th 2025 (10 business days from today), please deliver the requested information by spreadsheet in human-readable format.

If this request should be directed elsewhere, please inform us of the proper agency for the request.

Thank you in advance,

AJ Vincelli
(75% she/her)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into boxer and businessman George Edward Foreman (January 10, 1949 – March 21, 2025). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2025/03/21/sports/george-foreman-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: Law Enforcement Agencies Accessing the  Face Recognition System

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Law Enforcement Agencies Accessing the  Face Recognition System
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to learn: 1) which local, state and national law enforcement agencies can currently submit photos of people (probe photos) to be run through the Northeast Ohio Regional Fusion Center's face recognition system, and 2) which law enforcement agencies actually submitted probe photo(s)  for a search from January 1, 2023 to the date of the most recently available data.

Please provide any lists, logs, datasets, documents or policies showing this information.  With regard to agencies that have submitted probe photos, please provide logs, lists or datasets describing, as available, the name of the requesting organization, the number of requests made, the dates of the requests, and the number of requests granted.  If this information is maintained in a spreadsheet, such as Excel, I request that the record be produced in this format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Paul Tepper

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Personnel Division,

I hope this message finds you well.

I am writing to request any police reports, calls for service, and documented reprimands involving Stephen Presnull, a former employee of your organization. This information is intended for public use and will be made available to the public.

Please note that Stephen Presnull was a public servant, and the requested records are not for personal use but for transparency and public knowledge.

Thank you for your attention to this request. I look forward to your prompt response.

Stephen

title: Media engagment on MG Wins

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Media engagment on MG Wins
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records of communications between any member of the VMI Marketing and Communication Office, The Superintendent and his staff, the Board of Visitors and its staff Staff, and Mr. Tom Watjen with the Virginia Mercury, Cardinal News and the Washington Post on the subject of the BOV Special session, Maj Gen. Wins' contract, contract extension, new contract or related topics to include followup stories on any subjects related to MG Win's contract. This includes communications to provide the Virginia Mercury, Cardinal News and the Washington Post  Maj. Gen. Win's statement of March 6, 2025, Mr. Watjen's resignation letter, and the email to the VMI Faculty, staff, cadets, VMI Alumni Agencies, etc. of Maj. Gen. Wins' statement and other matters related to the subject and any fees charged. I am willing to accept incremental delivery. At the minimum, VMI should be able to provide the communications involving how the Washington Post became aware of, requested, and provided Mr. Watjen's resignation letter and the Superintendent's Statement on the BOV decision not to renew his contract immediately, as these stories were just published recently with those documents. For the purposes of this FOIA,  the Washington Post records do not include any of those already provided in my previous FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: FOIA Request for Records Pertaining to Alicia A. Orzel Arrest on June 30, 2023

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: FOIA Request for Records Pertaining to Alicia A. Orzel Arrest on June 30, 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request the following records related to the arrest of Alicia A. Orzel on June 30, 2023, at approximately 3:48 p.m. in the town of Edgewater on Lake Chetac:

All body-worn camera footage from deputies involved in the incident.

All dash camera footage from patrol vehicles present during the incident.

Incident and arrest reports detailing the circumstances of the arrest.

Any rear seat camera footage from patrol vehicles transporting Ms. Orzel.

Any other relevant audio or video recordings related to this incident.

This request pertains to charges of felony battery to a sheriff’s deputy and misdemeanor disorderly conduct during a child custody dispute.

I request a fee waiver as disclosure of these records serves the public interest by providing insight into law enforcement procedures and public safety matters, not for commercial gain.

Please provide the requested records in electronic format. If any records are exempt from disclosure, please specify the exemption and release any segregable portions.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

March 24, 2025

Police Cam News,

Response to Open Record Request:
I received your Open Records Request regarding:
Incidents involving Alicia A. Orzel, from June 30, 2023 for all BWC, Incident and Arrest Reports, All Dash Camera Footage

The Sheriff's Office did not have Dash Cam at this time of incident. 

We are in receipt of your request and will get this released as soon as possible.
Releasing your record in a more timely manner is now possible with our portal at https://sawyercountywi.nextrequest.  
Here, in our portal you can upload documents, pay online and receive all records in an email. 
Otherwise, we will notify you upon completion and all records will be released upon receiving payment in physical medium format.
Open Records are released in order received
Reproduction cost of $0.25 cents a page, plus $1.92 for each five-minutes, reflecting the assumed staff time involved to scan the document, attach it, and e-mailing, will be assessed. If manual research is required for retrieval, a fee will be determined in addition to the reproduction cost. According to Wisconsin Statute § 19.35(3) (c), we may charge the actual and necessary location costs using the locator’s hourly wage as the base cost.  Redaction cost will apply due to financial gain status. Redaction cost is based on the lowest paid employee’s hourly wage capable of performing the task. A representative of a person(s) on the report will be subject to a $1.92 redaction cost. 
Estimated Cost is $24.79
Due to the high demand for Open Records Request the estimated time is one month.
Please provide a waiver from the person(s) on the record releasing the images of them, and if any, of minor children present in the report, which would save redaction time. 
You will receive a notice upon completion of processing your request of the Open Record, if a response isn’t received within 10 business days, we will consider the request abandoned and closed. 
We accept Check, Money Order or Cash at the Sheriff’s Office.
Make payment payable to: Sawyer County Sheriff

Records will be released upon receiving payment.

title: Boston Crime Data Classification and Reporting Practices (2020–2025

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Boston Crime Data Classification and Reporting Practices (2020–2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

This request relates to public statements and data reported in the Boston Globe on March 4, 2025 (https://www.bostonglobe.com/2025/03/04/metro/boston-police-data-crime-declines/), which state:
Homicides fell from 56 in 2020 to 24 in 2024
Shootings dropped from 274 in 2020 to 129 in 2024
Robbery and aggravated assault remained relatively steady
Larceny and other property crimes saw a marginal increase
Downtown Boston experienced elevated larceny and robbery rates compared to prior years


To better understand how incidents are tracked and classified, I request:

1. Internal policies, manuals, or memos (2020–present) defining crime classification thresholds, especially for homicides, shootings, aggravated assaults, robbery, and larceny.
2. Documentation of any changes to crime coding or reporting methodology between 2020 and 2025.
3. A list or summary of reclassified or downgraded incidents during that period.
4. Any internal audits or reviews related to the accuracy or methodology of published crime statistics.
5. Anonymized CAD (Computer-Aided Dispatch) logs for 2024 and 2025 for comparison with official statistics.
6. Copies of Boston’s UCR or NIBRS submissions to the FBI for the years 2020–2025.
7. Copies of any email correspondence from January 1, 2023, to March 5, 2025, between BPD staff, the Mayor’s Office, or any City of Boston communications personnel discussing the preparation, presentation, or framing of crime statistics released to the public or media—including but not limited to the data cited in the Boston Globe on March 4, 2025.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

title: Public Records Request – Deltona Middle School SRO Assault (November 19, 2024)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request – Deltona Middle School SRO Assault (November 19, 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

On the morning of November 19, 2024, Jorge Rivera (46) and Dagmarie Aponte Iturrino (45) were arrested after allegedly assaulting a School Resource Deputy at Deltona Middle School in Deltona, Florida. According to the Volusia County Sheriff's Office, the deputy was attempting to handle a situation involving the couple's child when the parents became combative. Body-worn camera footage reportedly shows a physical struggle. News coverage confirms multiple deputies responded to the scene, and video footage exists.

I am requesting the following records related to the incident involving Jorge Rivera and Dagmarie Aponte Iturrino at Deltona Middle School on the morning of November 19, 2024:

All body-worn camera footage from any deputies present at the scene.

All vehicle dash camera footage, including from initial responding units.

Any rear seat in-car camera footage if either suspect was detained in a patrol vehicle.

The complete incident report, arrest reports, and supplemental narratives.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Public Records Request for Bodycam, Dashcam, and Related Footage – Arrests of Four Suspects on January 10, 2025

communications.subject: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request for Bodycam, Dashcam, and Related Footage – Arrests of Four Suspects on January 10, 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request access to the following records related to the arrests of four individuals on January 10, 2025, following a vehicle pursuit that ended near the Providence/Cranston line on Interstate 95:

Body-worn camera footage from all Providence Police Department officers involved in the pursuit, apprehension, and arrest of the suspects.

Dashcam footage from all patrol units engaged in the pursuit and subsequent arrest operations.

Rear-seat vehicle footage from the patrol units that transported the suspects following their arrests.

Incident reports or arrest reports relating the incident.

This request focuses on essential records that document the pursuit, apprehension, and arrest of the suspects involved in the armed robbery of a FedEx driver in Harvard, Massachusetts, and the subsequent pursuit that concluded in Providence, Rhode Island. If any additional footage (such as surveillance or helicopter footage) exists and provides significant context to the events, I request access to those records as well.

If it helps to locate the desired incident, here's a news report: https://www.wpri.com/news/local-news/providence/bodycam-video-shows-arrest-of-4-suspects-in-fedex-driver-robbery/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

Dear Mr. Bradley:

Thank you for submitting your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to
the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) via email to
foia@nara.gov. We received your request on March 24, 2025.  Your request
states:

*The OMPF for Charles Bump including history of assignments, military
education, transfers and receipts, administrative remarks, all military
decorations and citations, unit awards, Bronze Star Medal citations and
commendation medals. Served with Seal Team TWO, Plankowner, Vietnam War,
Detachment ALFA Please redact any sensitive information protected in
accordance with the Privacy Act of 1974.*

Due to the nature of your inquiry, we are forwarding your request by this
email to the National Personnel Records Center (NPRC) for Military Records
in St. Louis for appropriate handling.  The NPRC will assign your request a
tracking number and respond directly to you.  In the future, if you need to
contact the NPRC, you can do so by mail or fax to the following address:

National Personnel Records Center
1 Archives Drive
St. Louis, Missouri 63138

Telephone:   314-801-0800
Telephone (Toll Free):  1-866-272-6272 (only within the US)
Fax:  314-801-9195

For your reference, below you will find your original submission.

On our website at https://www.archives.gov/veterans/military-service-records
you can find information about requesting Official Military Personnel Files
(OMPFs) that are not yet archival records fully open to the public.  At the
website for the National Archives at St. Louis,
https://www.archives.gov/st-louis/ <https://www.archives.gov/st-louis/%20>,
you will find information about requesting Official Military Personnel
Files that are now archival records open to the public.  The OMPF normally
becomes an archival record 62 years after the date of discharge.

At www.archives.gov/foia <http://www.archives.gov/foia%20> we provide
information about FOIA.  On our home page, www.archives.gov, you can learn
about the resources that we offer to the public, and access our online
catalog.
